PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
XV Congresso da Sociedade Brasileira de Radioterapia, serб realizado na Fбbrica de Negуcios do Hotel Praia Centro em Fortaleza, de 29 de maio a 01 de junho de 2013.
Estima-se a participaзгo de 800 congressistas, visto que o programa cientнfico й elaborado a partir de assuntos de grande atualidade e do interesse de mйdicos das mais diversas especialidades, enfermeiros e demais profissionais da бrea de saъde.
O referido evento й uma iniciativa da Sociedade Brasileira de Radioterapia. Trata-se de um fуrum de aperfeiзoamento especнfico para profissionais da saъde, acadкmicos de medicina e бreas afins interessados no estudo e tratamento de patologias relacionadas а Oncologia, com кnfase em radioterapia (Tratamento do cвncer atravйs da radiaзгo ionizante).
Ano apуs ano, a Radioterapia vem crescendo e ganhando espaзo e visibilidade no cenбrio mйdico nacional e o Congresso da SBRT se consolida como a maior e melhor oportunidade de troca de experiкncias e conhecimentos entre mйdicos, fнsicos, residentes, enfermeiros e tйcnicos dentro da radioterapia brasileira, mantendo o espнrito multidisciplinar como um de seus principais elementos de sucesso. Atй 2015, a expectativa dos radio-oncologistas й que sejam criados e ampliados 80 serviзos de radioterapia de acordo com o plano de expansгo de atendimento oncolуgico do Governo Federal. Este fato, somado aos inъmeros avanзos terapкuticos da especialidade, cria para as indъstrias e empresas de serviзos especializados da бrea, uma oportunidade sem igual para apresentaзгo e divulgaзгo de seus produtos e soluзхes.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Impacto da Seqькncia do Tratamento Exclusivo no Cвncer do Colo Uterino Localmente Avanзado Campos CAMS№, Salvajoli JVІ, Novaes PEі, Silva MGC№, Oliveira JAA4, Neto FJM4 1Hospital de Cвncer do Cearб - Instituto do Cвncer do Cearб (ICC) 2Instituto do Cвncer do Estado de Sгo Paulo (ICESP). Sгo Paulo (SP), Brasil 3Instituto Santista de Oncologia (ISO). Santos (SP), Brasil 4Universidade do Estado do Cearб (UECE). Cearб, Brasil Introduзгo: O tratamento do cвncer avanзado do colo uterino inclui obrigatoriamente a radioterapia e poucos estudos avaliam a influкncia da sequкncia da radioterapia externa e da braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose no controle local e sobrevida. Objetivo: Avaliar o impacto da sequкncia da braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose e da radioterapia externa no controle local e sobrevida em 5 e 10 anos em pacientes com cвncer do colo uterino localmente avanзado. Metodologia: Um coorte retrospectivo com 413 pacientes (181 IIB e 232 IIIB) tratadas com radioterapia exclusiva 54 a 59,4 Gy na pelve e 24 Gy concomitante em 4 inserзхes semanais de braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose, sem quimioterapia, de janeiro de 1996 a junho de 1998, no Hospital do Cвncer do Cearб. O tempo mйdio de follow-up foi de 4,7 anos e o mйtodo de Kaplan-Meier foi utilizado para o cбlculo de sobrevida. A regressгo logнstica foi utilizada na avaliaзгo multivariada e o nнvel de significвncia de p<0,05. Resultados: A sobrevida global em 5 anos foi 60%, e 58% em 10 anos. O controle local em 5 anos foi de 49%. O tempo mйdio de tratamento foi de 60 dias. Trezentos e trinta pacientes (80%) realizaram a braquiterapia atй a sexta semana do inнcio da radioterapia externa. Conclusгo: O inнcio da braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose posterior а quarta semana da radioterapia externa tem influкncia negativa na sobrevida em 10 anos (Odds Ratio = 1,73).

Campos, M.M. Arregi y M.G. da Silva Hospital do Cancer do Cearб. Objetivos: El tratamiento estбndar para el cбncer de mama en estadio temprano consiste en cirugнa conservadora, biopsia del ganglio centinela o disecciуn de los ganglios axilares seguida de seis semanas de irradiaciуn externa sobre la mama. Datos de seguimiento a largo plazo muestran tasas bajas de recidiva local que, cuando se produce, suele ocurrir en las proximidades del lecho tumoral. Esto hace posible el uso de una fracciуn ъnica de irradiaciуn con electrones de alta dosis, sobre el lecho tumoral, durante la cirugнa (ELIOT). Evaluar la factibilidad de adaptaciуn de la sala de acelerador lineal de electrones para realizar la radioterapia intraoperatoria para el cбncer de mama en estadio temprano. Segundo, evaluar los costos del procedimiento y las ventajas para las pacientes. Mйtodos: Primero, se comprу un juego de conos con compatibilidad con el acelerador. En 01 de noviembre de 2007, fueron realizadas mediciones dosimйtricas de las energнas de electrones del acelerador linear 21EX Varian con un Wellhoufer en un maniquн de agua. Desde 15 de noviembre de 2007 fueron realizados quince procedimientos ELIOT, la mayorнa con 6 MeV de energнa de electrones y con cono de diбmetro de 57 mm, en el interior de la sala del acelerador lineal, adaptado a la mбquina del colimador. El tratamiento se hace los sбbados cuando el acelerador estб cerrado para otros procedimientos. Es necesario un equipo multiprofesional con enfermero, anestesista, patуlogo, cirujano, radioterapeuta, fнsico y tйcnico de radioterapia. El sбbado de la intervenciуn, la paciente llega al hospital temprano y se procede a la cirugнa e irradiaciуn en el departamento de radioterapia. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Hypofractionated breast irradiation in elderly cancer patients: a Brazilian pilot study
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Hypofractionated breast irradiation in elderly cancer patients: a Brazilian pilot study

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Journal of Clinical Oncology, 2012 Breast Cancer Symposium

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Conceiзгo Aparecida Machado de Souza Campos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Background: In 2025, Brazil will be the 6th country in the world with the most aged population represented by elderly (15% above 60 years). Nowadays, life expectance is around 65 years old and there is not sufficient data about cancer management in the elderly. Breast cancer is generally detected in more advanced stages and not well treated due to the other medical conditions. The hypofractionation garantees the same local control with mild acute reactions and no functional late complications in a shorter treatment time. Methods: The pilot study addressed the acute local morbidid and the local control of fourteen patients (stages I to III), median age 78 years that received one single 6.5 Gy weekly dose in 5-7 fractions with 6MV photons or 6MйV electrons to the breast or thoracic grid using tangential fields or direct field, accordingly to the patients anatomy (from August 2006 to April 2008). The total dose ranged from 32.5 Gy to 45.5 Gy. The supraclavicular nodes were treated if >= 4 axillary nodes were positive (3/14). Modified mastectomy was the most frequent surgical procedure (9/14). Node negative disease was discovered in seven patients, T2 lesions in eight, invasive ductal carcinoma in nine and positive estrogen receptor in ten. Ten patients had comorbid diseases, the most frequent was high blood pressure. The patients had weekly skin evaluation and were scored accordingly to the RTOG score. The patients were followed in consultation until April 2012. Results: Two cases of erithema were observed after the completion of the treatment. These patients received seven fractions due to boost at surgical bed. The other patients didn't show any acute reactions. To date we observed an early infraclavicular failure after the completion of the radiotherapy. There were two cases of fat necrosis and two fibrosis. There was only one local failure and a second primary in the contralateral breast. Conclusions: The hypofractionated scheme showed good skin tolerance. A longer

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Evaluation of the overall survival rates in locally advanced cervix cancer patients treated with radiotherapy alone and chemoradiation: A Brazilian experience
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Evaluation of the overall survival rates in locally advanced cervix cancer patients treated with radiotherapy alone and chemoradiation: A Brazilian experience

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Conceiзгo Aparecida Machado de Souza Campos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Background: Locally advanced cervical cancer is a major worldwide health problem. The treatment might include radiotherapy and few trials evaluate the timing of pelvic external irradiation (RT) and high dose rate brachytherapy (HDR) in local control and survival rates of these patients as well as the addition of chemotherapy. The objective were to evaluate the overall survival rates in locally advanced cervix cancer patients and determine the clinical and treatment prognostic factors for local control and overall survival rates. Methods: A retrospective cohort study was carried out with 261 patients stage IIIB, 164 patients received 54 Gy RT to the pelvis and 30 Gy HDR without chemotherapy and 97 patients received 54 Gy RT to the pelvis and 30 Gy HDR with weekly cisplatin 40mg/m2 IV (CDDP) from August 1998 to June 2004 in Hospital Haroldo Juacaba, a Brazilian northeastern hospital. The mean follow-up time was 50 months (2-185 months) and the Kaplan-Meier method was used to calculate survival curves. The Cox regression was used to evaluate multivariate analysis and p values =<0.05 was considered significant. Results: Local control and 5-year survival rates were 39.6% and 38.4% for exclusively radiation and 50.5% and 47.4% for chemoradiation (p = 0.19 and p = 0.36, respectively). The mean treatment time was 61 days. Both local control and overall survival rates were affected by age, parametrial involvement and the timing of brachytherapy (p<0.05). The overall treatment time did not influence survival or local control rates (p>0.05). But less than six cycles of chemotherapy improved local control rates better than six or more cycles (55.1% versus 44.9% p = 0.02). Conclusions: The study is a nonsuperiority one where the addition of weekly chemotherapy with six cycles of CDDP 40mg/m2 during the irradiation did not improve overall survival rates. Further prospective studies would be useful to evaluate the benefit of adding weekly chemotherapy to the standard radiotherapy

Results: Local control and 5-year survival rates were 39.6% and 38.4% for exclusively radiation and 50.5% and 47.4% for chemoradiation (p = 0.19 and p = 0.36, respectively). The mean treatment time was 61 days. Both local control and overall survival rates were affected by age, parametrial involvement and the timing of brachytherapy (p<0.05). The overall treatment time did not influence survival or local control rates (p>0.05). But less than six cycles of chemotherapy improved local control rates better than six or more cycles (55.1% versus 44.9% p = 0.02). Conclusions: The study is a nonsuperiority one where the addition of weekly chemotherapy with six cycles of CDDP 40mg/m2 during the irradiation did not improve overall survival rates. Further prospective studies would be useful to evaluate the benefit of adding weekly chemotherapy to the standard radiotherapy

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Once-weekly hypofractionated radiotherapy for breast cancer: First results of a phase II clinical trial
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Once-weekly hypofractionated radiotherapy for breast cancer: First results of a phase II clinical trial

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Conceiзгo Aparecida Machado de Souza Campos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Hypofractionated radiotherapy (HF) in 15 or 16 daily fractions is well established as an alternative in early breast cancer after breast‐conserving surgery. Evidences for a whole‐breast treatment even shorter, in 5‐10 fractions, are still scarce. Women 50 years or older, with early breast tumor (pT1‐2pN0), after breast‐conserving surgery were eligible to enter in this phase II trial and received whole breast once‐weekly hypofractionated radiotherapy (wHF‐RT) to a total dose of 30 Gy, in 5 fractions of 6 Gy. During treatment and in post‐treatment follow‐up the toxicity was assessed and graduated according to the ?Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events? (CTCAE), v3.0. Breast pictures for esthetic comparison were taken in 5 timepoints and 2 breast surgeons independently graduated the cosmetics changes. The trial was registered with ClinicalTrials.gov, number NCT01965483. From October 2013 to November 2015, 44 patients were enrolled in the trial and treated according to the protocol of wHF‐RT. The median age was 70.5 years (51‐88 years), and the median follow‐up was 22 months (9‐33 months). Skin erythema was the most common acute adverse event. At the end of radiation, 30 patients (68.2%) had any grade of radiation dermatitis. Concerning cosmetic appearance, there was no significant difference between pretreatment and 1 year assessments. The 2‐year overall survival and disease‐free survival were, respectively 96.8% and 97.7%. There was only one distant recurrence and no local or regional recurrence. Once‐weekly hypofractionated radiotherapy is a feasible and well tolerated alternative for early breast cancer adjuvant management with acceptable acute toxicity and esthetic outcomes.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:

A lesгo maligna linfoepitelioma (MLEL) й considerada uma das variedades do tipo planocelular, encontrando-se intensa infiltraзгo linfуide em seu estroma fibroso. Em relaзгo а incidкncia global do MLEL, hб uma predominвncia feminina, na proporзгo de 3:2 em relaзгo ao sexo masculino; no entanto, entre os pacientes chineses, o tumor й mais prevalente em homens1.
O MLEL envolve apenas as grandes glвndulas salivares, mais frequentemente a parуtida; cerca de 15% dos casos ocorrem na glвndula submandibular1. A patogкnese tem sido atribuнda ao vнrus Epstein Barr (EBV), em decorrкncia da detecзгo de oncoproteнnas virais em cultura de cйlulas tumorais. Uma vez ocorrida a infecзгo, o vнrus permanece por um longo perнodo de tempo com baixo grau de atividade nos ductos salivares epiteliais e em estado latente nos linfуcitos B2.
O EBV estб ligado a diversas neoplasias epiteliais, particularmente os carcinomas de nasofaringe indiferenciados (NPC). Recentes estudos indicam tambйm forte associaзгo da expressгo do EBV e o MLEL das glвndulas salivares em taiwaneses, chineses do sul da China e esquimуs3.
Pacientes com MLEL sгo aparentemente mais propensos a metбstases regionais e a distвncia. Esquimуs tкm 30% a 50% de incidкncia de metбstases regionais, ao passo que asiбticos tem 10% de incidкncia1.

Com resultado negativo para cйlulas neoplбsicas na PAAF, foi submetida а ressecзгo limitada da glвndula salivar direita em dezembro de 2006.
Em janeiro de 2007, foi encaminhada a um centro de referкncia oncolуgica com o diagnуstico histolуgico da peзa cirъrgica de carcinoma indiferenciado tipo linfoepitelioma

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Radioterapia Exclusiva para cвncer avanзado do colo uterino:a influкncia da sequencia da radioterapia externa e braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose no controle local e sobrevida em 5 e 10 anos

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XII Congresso da Sociedade Brasileira de Radioterapia

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Conceiзгo Aparecida Machado de Souza Campos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Introduзгo: O tratamento do cвncer avanзado do colo uterino inclui obrigatoriamente a radioterapia e poucos estudos avaliam a influкncia da sequкncia da radioterapia externa e da braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose no controle local e sobrevida. Objetivo: Avaliar o impacto da sequкncia da braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose e da radioterapia externa no controle local e sobrevida em 5 e 10 anos em pacientes com cвncer do colo uterino localmente avanзado. Metodologia: Um coorte retrospectivo com 413 pacientes (181 IIB e 232 IIIB) tratadas com radioterapia exclusiva 54 a 59,4 Gy na pelve e 24 Gy concomitante em 4 inserзхes semanais de braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose, sem quimioterapia, de janeiro de 1996 a junho de 1998, no Hospital do Cвncer do Cearб. O tempo mйdio de follow-up foi de 4,7 anos e o mйtodo de Kaplan-Meier foi utilizado para o cбlculo de sobrevida. A regressгo logнstica foi utilizada na avaliaзгo multivariada e o nнvel de significвncia de p<0,05. Resultados: A sobrevida global em 5 anos foi 60%, e 58% em 10 anos. O controle local em 5 anos foi de 49%. O tempo mйdio de tratamento foi de 60 dias. Trezentos e trinta pacientes (80%) realizaram a braquiterapia atй a sexta semana do inнcio da radioterapia externa. Conclusгo: O inнcio da braquiterapia de alta taxa de dose posterior а quarta semana da radioterapia externa tem influкncia negativa na sobrevida em 10 anos (Odds Ratio = 1,73).

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: The role of intra-operative electron irradiation in advanced oropharyngeal cancer

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Conceiзгo Aparecida Machado de Souza Campos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Research Proposal
Title: The role of intra-operative electron irradiation in advanced oropharyngeal cancer
Background: Advanced oropharyngeal tumors have a high level of local failure and full-dose irradiation may cause severe side effects.
Hypothesis: Intra-operative radiotherapy may play a role in the advanced oropharyngeal cancer as a palliative setting due to the dose limitation of the surrounding tissues.
Method and material of research: A pilot study with 10 patients with advanced oropharynx N2 and 3 primary cancer would be treated with daily radiotherapy (50 Gy) using conventional simulation, 3D beam arrangements, fractionation and energy and cisplatinum chemotherapy (100mg/m2) each 21 days, for 3 cycles. Perform a treatment evaluation after this course with CT image to evaluate resection of the cervical linfonodes and primary tumor. 20 Gy should be given to the surgical bed during the surgical procedure.
Expected results and potential conclusions: Feasibility of the procedure and follow-up to evaluate the local control could be assessed to implement the technique.
